pullRequest.body:
Resolves #10590 

---

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5186fa14-8209-4f0f-bd72-e851e52fbe32) for commit de1bd831eb2ea43c158503e2328343ceda7d86d9.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c6e2fb23-ac2f-4164-ba34-fa1ca99428f3/to/5186fa14-8209-4f0f-bd72-e851e52fbe32) against commit 9e78f5c2964d7d675d83ab46dab38df53a632083.

There is some discussion on Zulip about whether it's a bug that MetaM try/catch does not automatically rewind state: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics/topic/Tauto.20infinite.20loop/near/430663505.

If that turns out to be a bug, we can come back and remove the save/restore here. Until then, let's get this `tauto` bug fixed.

If we were worried about performance, we could define a local variant of `_root_.Lean.MVarId.replace` that fails when the hypothesis cannot be cleared. I have no strong preference between that approach and the current state of this PR.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ffe1a04f-074c-413d-bd06-a7bf230c5883) for commit 72c5f0a1188a4eb815dc3973c12c28e33d02e7cb.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2e478d48-2aa7-40c5-a708-fafa416b9a78/to/ffe1a04f-074c-413d-bd06-a7bf230c5883) against commit e8433a6b8e7980bfaaf9b34513b77da2af14995a.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9278122706/job/25528606333)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9278122706/job/25528606465)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9278122706/job/25528606627)

Looks good to me. Adding the extra `saveState` could potentially have a performance penalty, but none such showed up in the benchmark results.

I'd like to have another set of eyes on this before it gets sent to the queue, as the code is derived directly from my suggestions. @thorimur?
Please add a comment explaining why we throw the error (maybe with a link to https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/issues/10590)

The usual style in `test/` is to use `example` rather than `theorem`, eliminating the possibility of a name collision. If you want to note where this was copied from, you can put that explanation in a comment.

I found a nicer way to handle this backtracking:
```lean
  let replace (p : Expr) : MetaM AssertAfterResult :=
    commitIfNoEx do
      let result ← g.assertAfter fvarId h.userName (← inferType p) p
      let newGoal ← result.mvarId.clear fvarId
      return { result with mvarId := newGoal }
```
I pushed https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11799/commits/72c5f0a1188a4eb815dc3973c12c28e33d02e7cb with this change.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - fix: resolve infinite loop in tauto tactic

nodes.body: !bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/5186fa14-8209-4f0f-bd72-e851e52fbe32) for commit de1bd831eb2ea43c158503e2328343ceda7d86d9.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/c6e2fb23-ac2f-4164-ba34-fa1ca99428f3/to/5186fa14-8209-4f0f-bd72-e851e52fbe32) against commit 9e78f5c2964d7d675d83ab46dab38df53a632083.

Looks good to me. Adding the extra `saveState` could potentially have a performance penalty, but none such showed up in the benchmark results.

I'd like to have another set of eyes on this before it gets sent to the queue, as the code is derived directly from my suggestions. @thorimur?

There is some discussion on Zulip about whether it's a bug that MetaM try/catch does not automatically rewind state: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/239415-metaprogramming-.2F-tactics/topic/Tauto.20infinite.20loop/near/430663505.

If that turns out to be a bug, we can come back and remove the save/restore here. Until then, let's get this `tauto` bug fixed.

If we were worried about performance, we could define a local variant of `_root_.Lean.MVarId.replace` that fails when the hypothesis cannot be cleared. I have no strong preference between that approach and the current state of this PR.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/ffe1a04f-074c-413d-bd06-a7bf230c5883) for commit 72c5f0a1188a4eb815dc3973c12c28e33d02e7cb.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/2e478d48-2aa7-40c5-a708-fafa416b9a78/to/ffe1a04f-074c-413d-bd06-a7bf230c5883) against commit e8433a6b8e7980bfaaf9b34513b77da2af14995a.
